description._content: Photographer: Unknown, Non-Indian Subject: George Gustav Heye (GGH), Non-Indian, 1874-1957 Date Created: 1914 Catalog Number: N34267 Format: Acetate negative Dimensions: 5 x 7 in. Collection History: Documentation of MAI expeditions and excavations and those funded by George Heye before the creation of the Museum often includes photographs of camp life and expedition members. Description: George Gustav Heye seated in front of his camp tent at Mound 1, Burson Bell Farm. The tent is shaded by a large tree, and built up on a wooden platform. Place: Burson W. Bell's farm, Sandyston Township; Montague; Sussex County; New Jersey; USA Site Name: Burson W. Bell's farm, Sandyston Township Culture/People: Non-Indian Persistent URL:http://www.americanindian.si.edu/searchcollections/item.aspx?irn=333160 Repository:National Museum of the American Indian View more collections from the Smithsonian Institution.
